author: Staff Reporter
text:
An elderly couple were drugged in a second class reserved compartment of Mumbai-Nagercoil Express on Sunday night.

The incident came to light when the couple, Bala Naidu (68) and his wife Sankarammal (56), were found unconscious by the railway staff at Nagercoil junction on Monday morning.

The staff informed the Government Railway Police (GRP) and immediately the two were rushed to Kanyakumari Government Medical College Hospital at Asaripallam.

Mr. Bala Naidu, who is working in a hotel in Mumbai, after regaining consciousness, told the police that a young couple, who boarded the train in Andhra Pradesh, offered them a soft drink.

After drinking it, they became unconscious, he said.

Mr. Bala Naidu was travelling to his native village near Maniyachi to participate in a temple festival.

Inspector Arul Prakash of GRP said that Mr. Bala Naidu gained consciousness in the afternoon and gave some information in a dazed state. His wife was still unconscious.

More details would be known only after they gained total consciousness. Gold ornaments of Ms. Sankarammal and Mr. Bala Naidu and their three bags were in GRP custody, he said.
title: Elderly couple drugged on board train
